remarks: Perform induction over the multiplicative structure of ` NN ` .  If a property ` ph ( x ) ` holds for the primes and ` 1 ` and is preserved under multiplication, then it holds for every positive integer. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)
statement:
prmind.1 $e |- ( x = 1 -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
prmind.2 $e |- ( x = y -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
prmind.3 $e |- ( x = z -> ( ph <-> th ) ) $.
prmind.4 $e |- ( x = ( y x. z ) -> ( ph <-> ta ) ) $.
prmind.5 $e |- ( x = A -> ( ph <-> et ) ) $.
prmind.6 $e |- ps $.
prmind.7 $e |- ( x e. Prime -> ph ) $.
prmind.8 $e |- ( ( y e. ( ZZ>= ` 2 ) /\ z e. ( ZZ>= ` 2 ) ) -> ( ( ch /\ th ) -> ta ) ) $.
prmind $p |- ( A e. NN -> et ) $.
$d A x $.
$d ch x z $.
$d et x $.
$d ph y z $.
$d ta x $.
$d th x $.
$d x y z $.
